titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flatlands land patents and military commission 1974.016
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-10-16 14:28:02 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Flatlands land patents and military commission

physdesc.extent: in two oversize folders and one flat file folder.

did.abstract: Two land patents issued by colonial New York Governors Richard Nicolls and Thomas Dongan, dating from 1667 and 1685, for the Town of Amersfort (Flatlands) in Kings County. Also included is a commission of appointment to the Kings County Militia issued to Nicholas Schenk of Gravesend, dated 1787.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. L.B. Peters, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The items are housed by size and have no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Flatlands land patents and military commission, 1974.016, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. Finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2025.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Transcriptions of Dutch legal documents on Flatbush, Flatlands, and Gravesend (1978.034)
Supervisor of the Town of Flatlands account books (ARC.081)
Flatlands maps and surveys in the Teunis G. Bergen and Bergen family collection (ARC.006)
Flatlands, N.Y., Overseers of the Poor account book (2005.001)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two land patents issued by colonial New York Governors Richard Nicolls and Thomas Dongan, dating from 1667 and 1685, for the Town of Amersfort (Flatlands) in Kings County. Also included is a commission of appointment to the Kings County Militia issued to Nicholas Schenk of Gravesend, dated 1787.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
